intro: Acronia carrenoi, commonly known as the Carreno's acronia, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in the spring. Acronia carrenoi is often found in moist, tropical environments, where it thrives in partial shade. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
